blocks.text: Password attacks aim to obtain valid credentials through guessing, theft, or reuse of leaked information. Despite advances in authentication technology, password compromise remains a major attack vector.

Indicators include repeated failed login attempts, successful logins from unusual locations, and access attempts across many accounts using similar credentials. Credential stuffing attacks generate high volumes of automated authentication attempts.
Password reuse across services amplifies the impact of breaches. Attackers frequently test leaked credentials against unrelated systems, exploiting user behavior rather than technical flaws.
Multiâ€‘factor authentication, rate limiting, and anomaly detection significantly reduce password attack success. Monitoring authentication logs is critical for early detection.
